text: Dark Harvest is a 2007 novel by Norman Partridge. It is set in an unnamed Midwestern hamlet that each year sends its young men to confront the menace known as "Sawtooth Jack", a giant pumpkin-headed creature that arises from the corn each year; the one who succeeds wins the "October Prize", a year of bliss free from bills with a new car provided.http://www.darkscribemagazine.com/reviews/dark-harvest-norman- partridge.html Dark Scribe Publishers Weekly named it one of the 100 best books of the year.https://www.publishersweekly.com/978-1-58767-147-0 PW New Regency optioned the film rights, with Matt Tolmach to produce but was sold to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer in April of 2020 after New Regency putted the film into turnaround, The film will be released on September 24, 2021 by United Artists Releasing.https://deadline.com/2018/10/matt-tolmach-dark-harvest-michael- gilio-norman-partridge-novel-new-regency-1202488698/ Deadline ==References== Category:2007 novels Category:Midwestern United States in fiction Category:Novels set in the United States
title: Dark Harvest (novel)
